vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: Umotu is building infrastructure for a world where everyone can participate in the global economy—regardless of where they live or which bank they use.

ubi.title: $10/Day, Everyone Everywhere
ubi.description: Universal basic income as earned rewards for securing the network. Anyone with a phone can participate and earn.

capital.title: Capital Moves Freely
capital.description: Near-zero friction for payments and transfers—cross-border or local. Businesses pay ~0.1% to cover platform costs, individuals pay nothing.

sovereignty.title: Respect Monetary Sovereignty
sovereignty.description: We don't replace fiat currencies—we make them work better. Banks issue stablecoins pegged to their local currency. Monetary policy becomes more effective with broader reach and less friction.

vision.notReplacing: Umotu isn't competing with central banks. We're building better infrastructure for fiat currencies: less friction, global access, and improved market efficiency and resilience.

building.title: We're Building the Ecosystem
building.description: These apps showcase what's possible on Umotu. Some are ready now, others are coming soon. Developers worldwide are invited to build and launch on our platform.

sendMoney.description: Send UMT or stablecoins instantly to anyone, anywhere in the world—no banks needed.
sendMoney.example: Send $20 to your family abroad in seconds, not days. Zero hidden fees.

billPay.name: Bill Pay
billPay.description: Pay utilities, phone, internet, and more directly from your wallet.

savings.name: Savings Circles
savings.description: Traditional rotating savings (tontine, chit fund) made trustless with smart contracts.

microLoans.name: Micro Loans
microLoans.description: Peer-to-peer lending backed by your verified humanity and reputation.

rideSharing.name: Ride Sharing
rideSharing.description: Book rides paid in crypto. Drivers keep more, riders pay less—no middleman taking 30%.
rideSharing.example: A taxi ride in Lagos costs ₦800. Driver gets ₦799.2 instead of ₦560.

delivery.name: Delivery
delivery.description: Order food, groceries, or packages. Couriers earn fair wages in stable tokens.
delivery.example: Order lunch, pay in your local stablecoin, courier gets paid instantly.

publicTransit.name: Public Transit
publicTransit.description: Pay for buses, metros, and trains with a tap. No need to buy fare cards.

hotels.description: Book accommodations worldwide. Hosts accept stablecoins, guests save on fees.
hotels.example: Book a room in Bali for $40/night. Host receives $39.96.

flights.description: Search and book flights. Pay in crypto, earn UMT rewards.

tours.name: Local Tours
tours.description: Book experiences with local guides. Payments go directly to them.

localMarket.description: Buy and sell locally. QR-based payments make street commerce seamless.

ecommerce.description: Shop online from merchants worldwide. No card fees, no chargebacks.
ecommerce.example: Buy electronics from Shenzhen. Pay in stablecoins, save 3% vs credit card.

remittance.name: Remittance
remittance.description: Send money home. Recipients can cash out to local currency or keep it digital.

freelance.name: Freelance Work
freelance.description: Get paid for gig work instantly. No waiting 30 days for bank transfers.

homeServices.name: Home Services

benefits.noFees: Almost Zero payment processing fees—keep 99.9% of revenue
benefits.verifiedUsers: All users are verified humans—no bots or fraud
benefits.globalReach: Reach users in 190+ countries from day one

business.exampleText: A ride-sharing app on Umotu keeps 99.9% of fares vs 70% on traditional platforms. Drivers earn more, riders pay less.

learn.title: Learn
learn.subtitle: Everything you need to know about Umotu

whatIs.title: What is Umotu?
whatIs.subtitle: $10 a day, everyone everywhere
whatIs.intro: Umotu aims to let anyone earn about $10/day using just a smartphone. No expensive hardware, no special skills, no borders.
whatIs.noMiddleman: No middleman: You interact directly with the network—no bank account required
whatIs.globalAccess: Global access: Works anywhere with internet
whatIs.youOwnIt: You own it: Your wallet, your keys, your control
whatIs.visionText: Billions of people can help keep a public ledger honest and earn for it. On Umotu, phones do lightweight checks that make the network trustworthy.
whatIs.nameOriginText: Umotu takes inspiration from Paʻumotu, a Polynesian language. We use the name respectfully as a reminder to build for everyday people.

earn.title: How You Earn
earn.subtitle: Your phone works; you get paid
earn.intro: Your phone performs tiny tasks that help everyone—then you get rewarded.
earn.step1: 1) Prove you're human: a quick liveness check (and occasional refresh) ensures each person has one account.
earn.step2: 2) Help the network: your phone runs Data Availability (DA) sampling and other lightweight checks in the background.
earn.step3: 3) Earn daily rewards: you’re paid for this work, with a target around $10/day depending on network policy.
earn.localCurrencyText: Choose a payout token: local-currency stablecoins (where available) or UMT. Amounts target ~$10 USD value and may adjust with participation and market conditions.

whereMoney.title: Where Does $10 Come From?
whereMoney.subtitle: You earn because you do work
whereMoney.intro: It’s the #1 question. The short answer: because you provide a service the network needs.
whereMoney.realWork1: Data Availability Sampling: your phone checks that block data is available and correct
whereMoney.realWork2: Human Participation: you prove one-person-one-account to stop bots and spam
whereMoney.realWork3: These tasks protect everyone; without them the network weakens
whereMoney.utility: Utility: fast, low-fee payments people choose to use
whereMoney.consensus: Consensus: value that grows as more people can verify and agree on the rules
whereMoney.newTokens: New UMT tokens are created and shared with verified phone participants (not with validators)
whereMoney.fees: A portion of fees and builder bids is shared with phone sentinels for finalizing blocks
whereMoney.treasury: A small portion funds ongoing maintenance and stability programs
whereMoney.umotuSolution: Umotu rewards everyday phones (low practical cost to participate)
whereMoney.conclusion: It’s not a giveaway: you’re paid for work that keeps a shared financial infrastructure honest and useful.

security.title: Wallet Security
security.subtitle: Protect your money
security.intro: Your wallet is like a digital vault that only you control.
security.recoveryText: Your 12 secret words (recovery phrase) and your private key both unlock your wallet. Anyone who has either can move your funds.
security.rule1: NEVER share your 12 words or private key with anyone—not even Umotu contributors.
security.rule2: Write your 12 words on paper and store them offline. Do not store them in screenshots, photos, or cloud notes.
security.rule3: If you export your private key, keep it offline (paper, hardware, or an encrypted manager you fully trust).
security.rule4: If you lose your 12 words and private key, no one can recover your wallet.
security.warningText: Your private key grants full access. Revealing or copying it to other apps can expose your funds. Only export if you understand the risk.
security.revealText: You can reveal or export your private key in Wallet Settings. We require biometrics/PIN, show it only for a few seconds, and never upload it. Consider using a hardware wallet for large balances.
security.best1: Enable screen lock & biometrics on your phone.
security.best2: Keep the app updated to get the latest security fixes.
security.best3: Use a separate wallet for large savings; keep small amounts on your phone for daily use.
security.scamBannerText: If anyone asks for your 12 words or private key, it’s a scam.

stablecoins.title: Understanding Stablecoins
stablecoins.subtitle: Digital money that tracks local currency
stablecoins.intro: Stablecoins are digital tokens designed to track regular money (like USD, ZAR, NGN).
stablecoins.backedText: Stablecoins on Umotu are issued by regulated partners and designed to hold a 1:1 value with reserves. Issuers publish proof-of-reserves and redemption terms.
stablecoins.convertText: Convert through partner banks/exchanges, or spend directly where accepted.

economics.title: UMT Economics
economics.subtitle: Who gets what and why
economics.intro: UMT has a fixed supply of 100 billion tokens. Most of it is paid to everyday phone users who help keep the network honest.
supplyBullets: The vast majority of the token supply is reserved for phone participants over time and is released through the Emission Controller. The Emission Controller caps daily issuance at no more than 0.01% of the remaining supply, ensuring long-term sustainability. Under this schedule, approximately 68% of the total supply remains after 10 years, and about 15% remains after 50 years.
A small portion of the supply is created at launch for specific purposes, including an early user airdrop, a community sale, the foundation allocation, and an emergency reserve etc.
economics.premine: Launch Allocation (tentative, subject to change at mainnet launch)
economics.emissionsText: Each day the network can emit at most 0.01% of the remaining emissions pool. We budget that amount so verified phones target about $10/day, adjusting with how many people participate and market conditions.
economics.feesText: Sentinel helpers (optional, advanced) earn a share of transaction fees and builder bids. This is separate from daily emissions.
economics.transparencyText: Vesting schedules and wallets are public. Daily emission caps and realized payouts are posted in the app.
economics.disclaimerText: This is not investment advice. Rewards depend on network policy and participation. The app does not guarantee a fixed income.

contribute.title: How to Contribute
contribute.subtitle: Help build Umotu
contribute.intro: Umotu is open source and community-driven. Everyone can help—whether you code, translate, or simply share feedback.

code.title: Improve the Code
code.text: Fix bugs, add features, write tests, or review pull requests. Check our GitHub repos for the app, smart contracts, and backend services.

translate.title: Help with Translations
translate.text: Make the app feel natural in your language. Edit the i18n locale files and test every screen. Your edits help millions.

wordlists.title: Expand BIP-39 Languages
wordlists.text: Propose new or improved wordlists so more people can see their 12-word recovery phrase in their native language.

governance.title: Join Governance
governance.text: Read proposals, discuss openly, and vote in the app. Your voice helps guide network parameters and grant allocations.

community.title: Spread the Word
community.text: Tell friends, write tutorials, publish shorts, answer questions. A stronger community means a stronger network for everyone.

contribute.note: All contributions are voluntary. There is no formal employment or compensation unless specified in a grant proposal.

decentralization.title: Why Decentralization
decentralization.subtitle: No single point of control
decentralization.intro: Decentralization means no single company or government can shut the network down or confiscate your funds.
decentralization.benefit2: Lower fees: small network fees instead of 3–5% card fees
decentralization.benefit5: Transparent: anyone can verify how the system works
decentralization.howWorksText: Validators propose blocks every ~2 seconds. Phones (like yours) verify and finalize with lightweight checks. Many small contributions add up to strong security.

noCompany.title: No Company, No Customers
noCompany.subtitle: Understand the model
noCompany.intro: There is no 'Umotu, Inc.' controlling the protocol. Umotu is an open set of rules anyone can use.
noCompany.notCompany1: NOT a company with customer accounts
noCompany.notCompany2: NOT a bank or money transmitter
noCompany.notCompany3: NOT controlled by any single entity
noCompany.whatIs1: A protocol: like email or the web—open, interoperable rules
noCompany.whatIs2: Phone-first: runs with help from everyday smartphones
noCompany.whatIs3: Community-driven: you are a participant, not a customer
noCompany.foundationIntro: A nonprofit that supports the ecosystem (reference apps, docs, community programs) but does not control the protocol.
noCompany.foundationTask1: Maintains the mobile app & explorer as reference implementations
noCompany.foundationTask2: Operates some public infrastructure (others can run theirs)
noCompany.foundationNote: The Foundation cannot access your wallet and cannot reverse transactions.

scamPrevention.title: Avoid Scams
scamPrevention.subtitle: Protect yourself
scamPrevention.intro: The Umotu Foundation will NEVER DM you. Anyone pretending to be 'support' is a scammer.
scamPrevention.redFlag1: Someone claiming to be customer support
scamPrevention.redFlag3: Requests for your 12-word phrase or private key
scamPrevention.redFlag4: Promises of bonus tokens if you send funds
scamPrevention.redFlag5: Apps or sites asking you to 'activate' rewards
scamPrevention.truth1: There is no customer support that can reset your wallet
scamPrevention.truth2: All official updates appear in this app
scamPrevention.truth3: No one from Umotu will ask for your recovery phrase or private key
scamPrevention.truth4: Download this app only from the official Apple Store or Google Play

airdrop.title: Testnet Airdrop
airdrop.subtitle: Early users get recognized
airdrop.intro: You're early! Umotu is in testnet. Active testnet participants may receive an allocation when mainnet launches.
airdrop.step1: Create a wallet in the app
airdrop.step3: Use the app regularly during testnet
airdrop.whyTestnet: Testnet is essential: users learn wallet security, and the system is tested for security, robustness, and efficiency before mainnet.
airdrop.timeline: Mainnet is expected in Q1 or Q2 of 2026. The airdrop will happen around the same time mainnet launches.
airdrop.totalPool: Total airdrop pool: 1,000,000,000 UMT tokens. Your share depends on total participants and UMT price at launch.
airdrop.scenario2: 1M users: ~1,000 UMT per user, expected price ~$1, airdrop value ~$1,000
airdrop.scenario3: 10M users: ~100 UMT per user, expected price ~$20, airdrop value ~$2,000
airdrop.scenario4: 100M users: ~10 UMT per user, expected price ~$300, airdrop value ~$3,000
airdrop.disclaimer: These are projections only, not guarantees. Actual values depend on market conditions and program rules.
airdrop.reward: At mainnet, your testnet wallet may receive real tokens based on participation and program rules. Earlier and more active users are prioritized.
airdrop.note: Note: Testnet tokens have no value. Any mainnet allocation is determined by program policy at launch. All news about airdrop will be published only in this app.
